qas.question: Who was the Prussian Minister of War?
What was the time span that von Roon acted as minister?
He instituted a series of what regarding the Prussian military?
What was the first step in the reforms?

context: <a0_0>Albrecht von Roon<a0_0/>, the Prussian Minister of War from <a1_0>1859 to 1873<a1_0/>, put into effect a series of <a2_0>reforms<a2_0/> of the Prussian military system in the 1860s. Among these were two major reforms that substantially increased the military power of Germany. The first was <a3_0>a reorganization of the army<a3_0/> that integrated the regular army and the Landwehr reserves. The second was the provision for <a4_0>the conscription of every male<a4_0/> Prussian of military age in the event of mobilization. Thus, despite the population of France being greater than the population of all of the German states that participated in the war, the Germans mobilized more soldiers for battle.
